name: Seattle Microsoft Azure Meetup
description:
This group is meant to keep our broader community up to date on the Microsoft Azure Platform. We focus all of our meetings on white boarding, technology deep dives and hands on demos. In addition we welcome our community to present specific solutions they developed using the Azure platform. The content and discussions will be technically focused (no ROI/TCO, Marketecture discussions), all are welcome regardless of your knowledge/experience with Azure.

Who Should Attend : Anyone interested in Azure (IaaS/PaaS), developers (java, python, node.js, .net, NoSQL, SQL, OSS is welcome!), IT professionals, big data enthusiasts (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Hbase, Pig, etc), Azure customers, cloud enthusiasts

name: Nodebots for Parents and Educators
description:
Nodebots are physical systems programmed with Javascript, the language of the web, and Node.js. This meetup will be geared towards parents and educators who want to learn about Nodebots in order to better educate their STEM students and/or children. I will guide educators through the PodPi curriculum and together we can brainstorm ways to present these topics in an engaging and clear way to children. I will assume that each educator has the correct PodPi module (which comes with all necessary electronic components) for each meetup and I highly recommend subscribing:

https://shop.podpi.com/

We will be using the Johnny-Five library, Arduinos, and breadboards to prototype various PodPi projects. Let's explore different (or create new) STEM pedagogies together!

organizer.name: Chelsea Stauber
organizer.bio: Software Developer and a lover of all things STEM (particularly math, geophysics, nodebots, and STEM education). Trying to become more handy with power tools and electronic development. Interested in encouraging lady nerds or lady nerd wannabes.

name: Victoria NodeJS Meetup
description: All things Node. Packages, patterns, problems, polyfills, prototypes, other things that start with P, including pints.

name: Hyperledger Vancouver
description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community, as the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, Artificial Intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Because with HyperLedger we can.

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What.

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How.

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, and on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive Analysis of HyperLedger Startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.

organizer.name: Virendra
organizer.bio: Provides digital transformation for supply chain management solutions and helps increase market share.

name: Port Coquitlam Node and NodeBots Meetup
description: This group is for NodeJS, NodeBots, Robotics, IoT enthusiasts. All skills levels are welcome; students, professionals, retirees, we can all share ideas, build something useful or not so much ; just for the fun of it. You will get more out of the group if you bring your own computer, with any OS installed. Join our journey in Port Coquitlam into the world of robotics and computing!

name: Dun Laoghaire Node/Angular/Meteor/React meetup
description:
We are going to experiment with this meetup, We started with nodeJS and nodeschool, we are now thinking we can do more than just nodeJS, members drive what this group does so feel free to reach out and tell us what you would like to do, so far we have

• AngularJS

• ReactJS

• AWS Lambdas and AWS API gateway

• NodeJS

• SailsJS

Our guideline is that we write code or build products at the meet-up.

name: JS Lisbon (Frontend & Backend)
description:
Node.js, ReactJS, ExpressJS, Hapi.js, JavaScript, Neo4j, MongoDB...

MeetUps, Hackatons and Casual Coding sessions for all JS Ninjas in the Lisbon Area! 

[MeetUps during the summer will be held in primarily in Cascais/Estoril]

name: BigData Wales
description: A data group that is all things to do with dealing with, managing, handling and delivering BigData, in Wales!. Topics include Data mining, data analysis, MySQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, MongoDB, Cassandra, Node.js, scaling, engineering data, open-source, linkeddata, and beer.

name: Northampton .Net User Group
description: Welcome to the Northampton .NET user group. This new group has been created to provide developers interested in Microsoft's .NET framework with access to a community of their peers and forum to share the latest tools and techniques. Monthly meetings will offer the opportunity to hear expert speakers highlighting best practices and future directions. Whether you're working with WCF / MVC / WPF / TPL or branching out into TypeScript / Node.js, this group will have content that is of value to you.

name: Casablanca.DEV
description:
Started as Casablanca.rb, we continued as Casablanca.DEV to serve a broader community.

So we are gladly to represent for and by developers from Casablanca and around. With a special focus on web and mobile development.

We discuss ideas for applications and techniques and approaches for developing them. Share projects, opportunities, and how-tos related to this. 

Currently our Community cover the current technologies: 

• Ruby (on Rails)

• Python (Django)

• PHP (Laravel)

• Java

• Node.js

• Javascript

• Ember.js 

• React 

• Angular.js

name: Polyglot Tech London
description: A series of events that compare and contrast various technologies to help choose the right tool for the job. So far we did: Angular vs React, Elixir vs Ruby, Erlang/Elixir vs Node/Clojure in Berlin, London, Paris, Warsaw and San Francisco

name: MEAN Stack
description:
This group is for anyone interested in learning more about the MEAN Stack (MongoDB, ExpressJS, AngularJS and Node.js) which is the latest stack around allowing developers to do rapid application development and application scaffolding.

Join us if you're interested in this new development stack or if you're simply interested in full stack web development, especially JavaScript as a programming language.

All skill levels are welcome as we do have presentations that are for absolute beginners and we also bring in experts to deliver in detail presentations about particular technologies.

organizer.name: Elmar Gasimov
organizer.bio: I am the founder of Bungaloow (it allows you to manage your property portfolio and keep track of your property valuation and potential for rental income). I am also an avid software engineer and enjoy designing websites/apps. Feel free to connect!

name: MarkLogic User Group UK
description:
The MarkLogic User Group UK is a group for users and/or fans of MarkLogic and those who are interested in learning more about MarkLogic Enterprise NoSQL database technology. We'll host informal events for users to meet, discuss, and share best practices regionally. This is an easy way to meet peers and learn how to get more out of MarkLogic Server. This is your Meetup group, so please tell us what you would like to hear!

Want to know more about MarkLogic?  Read on >>

MarkLogic® is a new generation database platform that enables organisations to get more value from more data than ever before. Global enterprises and governments rely on MarkLogic to power intelligent, high performance applications aimed at analysing data for better insights and also running crucial day-to-day business operations. With MarkLogic, organisations achieve faster time-to-value than was possible with legacy databases, while minimising risk and improving data quality.

MarkLogic is the only Enterprise NoSQL database—a powerful, agile, trusted database that has the speed and scale of NoSQL coupled with the enterprise features required.

· Develop stronger applications faster with a flexible data model using Full-Stack JavaScript, JSON and Node.JS

· Find relevant information easier with lightning fast, built-in search

· Gain more intelligence in the data layer using semantics and bitemporal

· Maintain data resiliency and consistency with ACID transactions, scalability and elasticity, certified security,   and high availability and disaster recovery

name: MEAN BH
description: Desenvolvedores Full-Stack JavaScript. Desenvolvimento de aplicações web com MongoDB, Express, Angular e Node.

organizer.name: Marcelo Costa de Oliveira
organizer.bio: Empreendedor Mobile, Investidor da Inovação, Tenista Amador, Fã de Anos 80 e Torcedor do Galo! Cofundador da Take.net, Mobyra, Confrapar e Minutrade.

name: São Paulo AngularJS Real apps Meetup
description: Esse é um grupo para aqueles que já tem alguma experiência com Angular.js. Nossas palestras serão sobre usos reais do framework em produção. Também haverá palestras sobre a interação de Node.js com Angular.js.

name: Delicious Meetups
description:
Delicious Meetups, ce sont des meetups ponctuels en soirée, en semaine, chez Delicious Insights, autour de sujets qui nous passionnent : Git, GitHub, JavaScript, le dev front-end, Node.js…

Tout ça entre 19h et 21h, chez Delicious Insights, pour jusqu'à 60 personnes. Le thème / sujet précis change à chaque fois, restez à l'affût !

name: Best Of Web
description:
Après le succès de l'année précédente, vos meetups se réunissent une nouvelle fois pour organiser une journée sur le thème du Best Of des talks de l'année. Nous vous proposons un mixte des meilleurs conférences, de nouveaux sujets et pleins de surprises...

Les meetups participants sont :

• AngularJS-Paris

• Backbone Paris

• Paris WebComponents 

• EmberJs Paris

• CSS Paris

• Node.js Paris

• PhoneGap Paris

• D3.js Paris

• Paris JS

• Meteor

• React.js Paris


Retrouvez toutes les informations sur notre site

http://bestofweb.paris/ 

Ou sur notre compte twitter 

@bestofwebconf

name: High Performance Computing & Supercomputing Group of Paris
description:
On High-Performance Computing

- GPU / Multi-core / Many-core / Xeon Phi / FPGA

- distributed systems: compute and storage nodes, architectures

- algorithms and data structures

- open source tools and libraries

- design, development, testing, deployment and system admin

.. and more!

name: ParisHackers
description:
We are a group of hackers (not crackers), often readers of Hacker News, that meet regularly in Paris to discuss a wide area of topics like Entrepreneurship, Node.js, Fundraising, Webdesign, Apple fanboyism, FabLabs, Clojure, Start-up stories, arcane C++ optimization tricks, BitCoin, ramen profitability, … you get the idea : whatever might be hot and interesting.

We decided to move to http://www.meetup.com after organizing two successful events in 2011.

organizer.name: Kaze A. ONGUENE 凱澤 龍格涅
organizer.bio: Futuristic Thinker and Entrepreneur. Involved in open source community over 10 years. Meteor.js believer, traveller and happy father of 2 little boys. www.braincities.co

name: node-bots
description: NodeSchool is an open source project run by volunteers with two goals: to create high quality programming curriculum and to host community learning events. The learning events are in-person hosted workshops in which "workshoppers" are used as curriculum and mentors help attendees work through the challenges. Workshopper is the name used for the open source lesson modules associated with NodeSchool. All are self guided (you don't need to attend a workshop to do one) and most work offline.
